A woman with long hair giving her hair to make offerings to the Buddha. Once there was a woman.
She was upright with dark hair, her hair the same length as her body.

A woman with a strange pregnancy gives birth to four kinds of unusual things. A woman with a strange pregnancy gives birth to four kinds of unusual things. There was a married couple who had no children.

The gods then agreed.
She consequently became pregnant.

First, a sandalwood bushel filled with rice.
Second, a jar of nectar.
Third, a treasure bag.
Fourth, a seven-jointed divine staff.
The man exclaimed:
I seek a son to be reborn and other things.
He then went to the deity and earnestly requested his wishes.
The deity then said:
What do you wish to gain from a son?
He replied:
A son should be able to provide for and support us.
The deity said:
This rice bushel can be used up without end.
The jar of nectar and honey can be eaten without depletion.
And it eliminates a hundred illnesses. The treasure bag is seen to be inexhaustible.
The seven-jointed divine staff is ready for violent situations.
How can a son accomplish this?
The man was overjoyed.
He returned home to test it, and it was not false as he had said.
He then became extremely wealthy, beyond calculation.
The king heard of this.ğŸ”½He immediately dispatched troops to go and attack and seize it.

A woman's mind is attached to a man, mistakenly tying her child to a well. A woman's mind is attached to a man, mistakenly tying her child to a well. Chapter 14: The man who is obsessed with lust.
Would rather lose his relatives.
Without resting his mind in lustful affairs.
On the outskirts of the city of Shravasti, there was a woman.
Holding her child and carrying a jar, she went to the well to draw water.
There was a man with a handsome appearance.
Sitting to the right of the well, playing the lute and amusing himself.
Women are often lustful and attached to men.
Men also enjoy women. Women are confused and agitated.
Tying the child's neck with a rope, he hung it in the well.
Soon he pulled it out again.
The child was already dead.
Grieving and distressed, he cried out to the heavens and fell to the ground in tears.
He spoke a verse himself.
The Buddha gathered the great assembly and told the bhikshus.
The fire of lust is raging and can burn the roots of goodness.
Those who are licentious do not recognize good and evil, do not distinguish between purity and impurity, and do not know what is binding and what is liberating.
Such people eventually become shameless.ğŸ”½They would rather lose their relatives and suffer punishment and humiliation.
Some, due to adultery, kill their parents, siblings, and other relatives.
They are executed by the king and suffer evil retribution after death.
They are reborn endlessly.
In the past, there was a man
who was deeply fond of adultery.
He was the only son born to his parents.
In the middle of the night,
during a dark and stormy sky, he took his sword and arrows and went to the village of prostitutes.
At that time, his mother noticed and tried to stop him,
saying that it was a dark night and he might be harmed by others.
I have few blessings and only have one son.
If I encounter evil people, I have no one to rely on.
The son replied to his mother,
I cannot stay here any longer.
The mother knew his mind was set,
so she went to his room.
She then drew her sword and killed her mother.
She then knocked on the prostitute's door.
The woman replied,
Who are you? He recited in reply,
The faculties of lust and anger are weak, deluded by thoughts,
Not considering various affairs, covered by ignorance and darkness,
Now I take my mother and harm her, subduing her like a slave,
Standing outside the door, like a guest waiting to be employed.
The woman replied in verse,
Alas, you betray kindness and nurture, harming your mother, creating the sin of destruction.
How can you bear to see your face? You should quickly leave my house.
Parents hold and nurture, going through various sufferings for their child.
Harming one's mother while walking on the ground, the earth does not sink you to death.
The man again said to the woman,
You have created boundless sins by harming your mother.
Please show a little leniency.
Open the door and let me briefly talk.
He then returned home.
The woman replied,
Rather enter a charcoal furnace, or jump from a mountain into a deep valley,

Borrowing and taking much but returning little, one is reborn as a calf. In the past, there was an elder who lived in boundless wealth.

She gradually became disgusted with her brother and came to borrow flour from him.
The elder said,
Go yourself to get it.
The sister then pressed and took it.
She held it as if returning it.
The elder was also unaware that it was not the first time.
After the sister's life ended, she was reborn as a calf in her brother's house.
The elder loved it very much and raised it to be fat.
When it was about to be killed for a god sacrifice,
at that time, five hundred merchants wanted to borrow money from their host and rest.
They wandered outside and asked each other,

The last person said,ğŸ”½I borrowed five hundred coins.

At that time, the calf was at the side.
It then spoke in human language.
Why do you have this thought?
I am the host's sister.
Sitting and borrowing flour, deceiving my brother.
Now, having become a cow body, I come to repay my brother's debt.
At that time, the five hundred merchants.
Hearing its words, they all trembled.
They all stopped taking up money and left. Excerpted from the Essentials of the Sutras.
